Maze

Class StartMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • Maze.StartMenu
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class StartMenu
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.lang.Runnable, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
    The animated main menu seen at the startup of each game session.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Paints the images in a double-buffered manner, in order to reduce any "streak" or flickering effects.
        Overrides:
        paint in class java.awt.Window
        Parameters:
        g - 2D Graphics object
        See Also:
        paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics)

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
                    throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Handles the creation of the five rectangles to be animated, paints them, and employs collision detection for when they hit the edges of the JFrame or one another. Creates and handles the animated difficulty buttons which change colour upon being hovered over by the mouse. Sets the difficulty and begins the game when a difficulty button is clicked. When the mouse hovers over the black rectangle with a white border (r4), the names of the authors are displayed in r1, r2, and r5. Finally, a call to repaint is made, in order to create an animated effect for each object.
        Parameters:
        g - 2D Graphics object
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        See Also:
        StartGame, paint(java.awt.Graphics), setDif(int)

      • getDif

        public static int getDif()
        Returns the difficulty setting chosen by the user at the beginning of the game. Easy, Medium, and Hard are represented by an integer of 1, 2, and 3 (respectively). This difficulty setting is made use of by the GamePanel class.
        Returns:
        #dif The difficulty setting as an integer value.
        See Also:
        GamePanel

      • setDif

        private void setDif(int d)
        Sets the difficulty setting chosen by the user at the beginning of the game via the Easy, Medium, and Hard buttons. Easy, Medium, and Hard are represented by an integer of 1, 2, and 3 (respectively).
        Parameters:
        d - Difficulty integer
        See Also:
        getDif()

      • mousePressed

        public void mousePressed(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Sets the static boolean mouseClicked to true, upon each mouse click. This mouse function is used by the paintComponent method to select a difficulty for the game.
        Specified by:
        mousePressed in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
        Parameters:
        e - MouseEvent event type
        See Also:
        paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics)

      • mouseMoved

        public void mouseMoved(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Sets the static boolean mouseOnScreen to true, upon each mouse movement in the JFrame. Also updates the current mouse position (m_x, m_y), which aids the paintComponent method in animating each difficulty button.
        Specified by:
        mouseMoved in interface java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
        Parameters:
        e - MouseEvent event type
        See Also:
        paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics)

      • mouseReleased

        public void mouseReleased(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)

        Specified by:
        mouseReleased in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
        Parameters:
        e - MouseEvent event type

      • mouseEntered

        public void mouseEntered(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Sets the static boolean mouseOnScreen to true, upon each mouse entry into the JFrame. Sets the initial mouse position (m_x, m_y).
        Specified by:
        mouseEntered in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
        Parameters:
        e - MouseEvent event type
        See Also:
        paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics)

      • mouseExited

        public void mouseExited(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Sets the static boolean mouseOnScreen to false, upon each mouse exit out of the JFrame. Also aids the paintComponent method in animating each difficulty button.
        Specified by:
        mouseExited in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
        Parameters:
        e - MouseEvent event type
        See Also:
        paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics)
